cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi (375 km) E of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW then NW, cross the Yucatán Peninsula late Saturday, and move into the central Gulf of Mexico Sunday on a general northwest course toward the upper Texas–western Louisiana coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas or far-western Louisiana coast (near the TX/LA border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla and the Bay Islands of Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Caribbean coast of Honduras, Yucatán Peninsula, and northern Gulf coast from Texas to Louisiana within 5 days
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤4%) chance of tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds reaching the port late Monday night into Tuesday; strongest winds likely to remain west of the Mississippi Delta
weather_observation.storm_surge: No surge guidance yet for southeast Louisiana from this system in early outlooks
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring heavy downpours to southeast Louisiana beginning late Monday; localized totals of 4 inches or more cannot be ruled out if the track shifts east
weather_observation.other_hazards: Reduced visibility and potential temporary river current disruptions from prolonged rainfall
